revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus and the Eclipse of the Sun in 1769
tldr: The author describes his observations of the transit of Venus and the solar eclipse on June 3, 1769, made at the Royal Observatory. He discusses the telescope used, the phenomena observed, and the measurements taken during the event. The observations were made by several individuals, including Nevil Maskelyne, Malachy Hitchens, William Hirst, John Horsley, Samuel Dunn, Peter Dollond, and Edward Nairne.
